column4: hellow i am a beginer and i am trying to right a file that is 1 gig to 2 cd's i do not have a dvd rw drive and i need to move these files to a windows machine does anyone know of a program that will do this for ubuntu???

hellow i am a beginer and i am trying to right a file that is 1 gig to 2 cd's i do not have a dvd rw drive and i need to move these files to a windows machine does anyone know of a program that will do this for ubuntu???
no i'm not leaveing till i find somethign
man split is a command, it opens the man page for split which is something that can split your file
thats how i read it first, but then i realized what he was saying
this is what i normally do man split > ~/Desktop/split.txt
that will copy the man page into a txt document on your desktop that you should be able to double click and open in gedit
no idea if there is a better way, but thats how i always do it
are you just trying to split a file into two parts?
sorry, i too am reading the man page
fyi, i wont know you said something to me unless you type my whole name but as you suspected, im not sure how you could rejoin the files once in windows

what i am thinking is to rar your zip file into a multivolume archive (2) and then store each part on a disc, then in windows, copy them to your hard drive and unrar them to get the zip, then unzip it to get your files
does makeing a rar split the file?????
no, you have to specify that which is what im trying to figure out
i thought rar was just like zip
what size does each part need to be?
looks like brandon got your answer
